resource.chars:
Author of this paper would find it easy to do so, with 
-out the adoption of words, phrases & turns of expression 
such as those I have indicated by pencil marks in 
pages 63, 68, 69, 71, 72, <u>73<\u>, 74, 75, <u>76<\u>, 77, <u>78<\u>, (NB.) 79.80, 81,
82, <u>83<\u>, 84, 85, of Vol.7. and pp. 2, 16, 73, 80 of Vol.9., to which,
especially those underlined, I beg to call the attention 
of the Council. -
Many of the Meteorological results are of great value 
especially those which indicate the closer attendance 
of changes of season on the Sun’s annual movement,
aloft than below - The remarks on the geographical Zones 
of plants in relation to the distribution of moisture as 
well as of temperature in p.75. Vol.9. et seq. appear to me 
curious and interesting. -
In respect of the publication of the Steoroscopic 
photographs, I know not whether in the first place,
Engravings <u>can<\u> be executed so faithful to originals as to 
convey the Steoroscopic Effect - And there are certainly 
some among them, which it would not be necessary 
to incur the heavy expense of engraving - But of this 
the Council must judge. -
JFW Herschel 
Sep.7. 1857
